cyclone.name: FAY
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles ENE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-to-north-northeast, skirting the Delmarva coast Friday and moving inland across New Jersey toward southern New England Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to southern New Jersey coast (near Cape May–Atlantic City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cape May, NJ northward to Watch Hill, RI, including Long Island and Long Island Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cape May, NJ northward to Watch Hill, RI, including Long Island and Long Island Sound (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic coastline from North Carolina through New Jersey and into southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Gusty tropical-storm-force winds possible, especially Friday; strongest gusts 30–40 mph likely east of Baltimore
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected to exceed 3 ft in the upper Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain likely Friday into early Saturday with potential flash-flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal flooding along western Chesapeake tributaries and reduced visibility hindering cargo movements
